content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata xml:lang="en"> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative</origin> <pubdate>20131028</pubdate> <title>Baseline (1961-1990) average air temperature (degree C) for Alaska and Western Canada.</title> <geoform>raster digital data</geoform> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Fairbanks, AK</pubplace> <publish>Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative</publish> </pubinfo> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract> Baseline (1961-1990) average air temperature (degree C) for Alaska and Western Canada.  Baseline results for 1961-1990 are derived from Climate Research Unit (CRU) TS 3.1 data.  Data courtesy of Scenarios Network for Alaska and Arctic Planning.  The file names identifies whether a file represents an annual (i.e., annual) mean or a seasonal mean (i.e., summer or winter).   Summer is defined as June - August; winter is defined as December - February. </abstract> <purpose>This raster was created to depict 'baseline' conditions for climate maps created by Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative staff.  For the purpose of these data, baseline is the period between 1961 and 1990.</purpose> <supplinf>For more information on Scenarios Network for Alaska and Arctic Planning climate projections and CRU data downscaling, please see http://www.snap.uaf.edu/downloads/alaska-climate-datasets.</supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <rngdates> <begdate>19610101</begdate> <enddate>19901231</enddate> </rngdates> </timeinfo> <current>ground condition</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>As needed</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-180</westbc> <eastbc>-88</eastbc> <northbc>72</northbc> <southbc>36</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt> <themekey>climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>None</placekt> <placekey>Alaska</placekey> <placekey>Yukon</placekey> <placekey>British Columbia</placekey> <placekey>Alberta</placekey> <placekey>Saskatchewan</placekey> <placekey>Manitoba</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>None.</accconst> <useconst>None. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data to evaluate data set limitations, restrictions or intended use. Neither the Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative (Arctic LCC) or Scenario Network for Alaska and Arctic Planning (SNAP) shall be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein.</useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative</cntorg> </cntorgp> <cntpos>Geospatial Specialist</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing address</addrtype> <address>101 12th Ave, Room 110</address> <city>Fairbanks</city> <state>Alaska</state> <postal>99701</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>907 456 0327</cntvoice> <cntemail>data@arcticlcc.org</cntemail> <cntinst>Contact via email is preferred.</cntinst> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <datacred>Created by Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative staff; data provided by Scenarios Network for Alaska and Arctic Planning.</datacred> <secinfo> <secsys>FIPS Pub 199</secsys> <secclass>No Confidentiality</secclass> <sechandl>Standard Technical Controls</sechandl> </secinfo> </idinfo> <dataqual> <logic>QA/QC completed by Originator.</logic> <complete>The spatial extent includes Alaska, the Yukon Territories, British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan, and Manitoba.</complete> <lineage> <procstep> <procdesc> Data originates from the Climatic Research Unit (CRU, http://www.cru.uea.ac.uk/) TS 3.1.01 dataset that was downscaled to 2km by SNAP. These files are bias corrected and downscaled via the delta method using PRISM (http://prism.oregonstate.edu/) 1961-1990 (for 2km Alaska and Western Canada data).  Questions about the CRU dataset should be addressed to SNAP.  Climate data downloaded from the SNAP website (http://www.snap.uaf.edu/downloads/alaska-climate-datasets) and subsequently processed by Arctic LCC staff using ArcGIS 10.0 and 10.1 software.  Arctic LCC staff used the downscaled data to calculate baseline average air temperature. </procdesc> <procdate>2012</procdate> </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual> <spdoinfo> <direct>Raster</direct> <rastinfo> <rasttype>Grid Cell</rasttype> </rastinfo> </spdoinfo> <spref> <horizsys> <planar> <mapproj> <mapprojn>Albers Conical Equal Area</mapprojn> <albers> <stdparll>55</stdparll> <stdparll>65</stdparll> <longcm>-154</longcm> <latprjo>50</latprjo> <feast>0</feast> <fnorth>0</fnorth> </albers> </mapproj> <planci> <plance>coordinate pair</plance> <coordrep> <absres>0.002048</absres> <ordres>0.002048</ordres> </coordrep> <plandu>meters</plandu> </planci> </planar> <geodetic> <horizdn>North American Datum of 1983</horizdn> <ellips>Geodetic Reference System 80</ellips> <semiaxis>6378137.000000</semiaxis> <denflat>298.257222</denflat> </geodetic> </horizsys> </spref> <eainfo> <detailed> <enttyp> <enttypl>Average air temperature (degree C)</enttypl> <enttypd>Baseline (1961-1990) average air temperature (degree C).</enttypd> <enttypds>Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative</enttypds> </enttyp> </detailed> </eainfo> <distinfo> <distrib> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative</cntorg> </cntorgp> <cntpos>Geospatial Specialist</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing address</addrtype> <address>101 12th Ave, Room 110</address> <city>Fairbanks</city> <state>Alaska</state> <postal>99701</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>907 456 0327</cntvoice> <cntemail>data@arcticlcc.org</cntemail> <cntinst>Contact via email is preferred.</cntinst> </cntinfo> </distrib> <resdesc>Raster files</resdesc> <distliab>None.
